result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy D. Anderson

records.addlTxt: Order for Appearance at Settlement Conference; Report to Court on Results of Settlement Conference.

*Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin without prior notice to and written approval of the Court.  Must report to the Taylor County Sheriff's Office for Booking Procedure. Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.

1:08 pm  Defendant Jeremy D. Anderson in court.  Attorney Kristi S. Tlusty in court for State of Wisconsin. Court advised DE of charges and penalties; advised of right to attorney.   Defendant waives time limits for a preliminary hearing. District attorney requests a signature bond in the amount of $1,000.00; booking; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription.   Court sets bond as requested.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 29, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Initial appearance on November 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
